data.title: Something for Everyone
data.text: We recently visited Reid Park for a blues festival with our small grandchildren.  It was lovely setting, nice grassy areas, large trees with lots of shade and cabana areas with bbq grills for groups.  A playground area was near the concert area so the children could play while we enjoyed the music.  There's a large pond with ducks, a fountain and a small train runs around the perimeter. Fun for the little ones.  A little further over was the zoo, so there is a lot going on in a small area.  The park also has a beautiful golf course, running paths, dog park and a recreation complex.

data.title: Good mid-town picnic place
data.text: Nice grass areas with large shade trees, ramada, and picnic tables. Adjacent golf course, swimming pool, and zoo.  Plenty of close parking. There is a lake, small hill, and waterfall.  Good place to chill out from the stress of urban life.

data.title: Reid Park
data.text: a beautiful park with lots of winding trails for walking. A lovely pool with ducks to feed in the middle of this park. At times there ar concerts in a shell. adjacent to the zoo.

data.title: Best little zoo
data.text: Love Ried park zoo. So cute and fun. Love this zoo and Ried park. We bring visitors here. Most zoos i don,t like up this one is up close and personal.

data.title: Okay
data.text: if you need to take the kids for regular fun away from desert stuff - this is a good break. The Zoo is here also which is great as well

data.title: Great atmosphere
data.text: We had a company picnic here in May 2016. It was a great success and we hope to make it an annual event. The price for the Ramada was very reasonable and the amenities great.

data.title: Great for Birding!
data.text: Well kept facility, clean, safe. Many wild birds to see including Vermillion Flycatcher, Cooper's Hawk, and Neo-tropical Cormorant when we were there. Ponds and playgrounds with meandering paths were highlights. Convenient location. Way to go Tucson!

data.title: Exhilerating!
data.text: There is a playground for the younger set. Picnic tables and plenty of shade trees to enjoy on a pleasant walk that includes a landscape of hills and waterfalls with a lake to watch the ducks. A very good zoo that can be enjoyed, as well.

data.title: Zoo, Golf, Tennis, Swimming and great walking trial
data.text: Reid Park is a wonder in central Tucson.  It has an 18-hole golf course, practice greens, golf pros at the driving range,  a large pool, several tennis courts , a three-mile walking path that's good day or night, a park for just sitting, and many courses, such as photography and ceramics, for example, are offered at reasonable prices.  This is a jewel in the heart of the city.

data.title: Central City Park.
data.text:
I arrived in Tucson in 1951 at age 1 and have attended a variety of events & activities at Reid Park. Currently my favorite activity is at Hi Corbett Field home to the University of Arizona Wildcats baseball team. Since 2012 the UofA Wildcats have called Hi Corbett home & were the NCAA CWS Champions in 2012. This past season (2016) the Wildcats again returned to Omaha for the NCAA CWS & finished 2nd. Hi Corbett was built in the 1920s & has been a MLB Spring Training home for the Cleveland Indians & Colorado Rockies. From Feb thur late May the UofA Wildcats are entertaining Tucson fans & winning baseball games. Several secondary fields host high school, small college (US & International) & summer league baseball tournaments.
Reid Park also offers golfing, swimming, picnic shelters, a zoo and lots of walking/biking trails. There are plenty of shade trees & grassy areas to rest & relax in our beautiful southern Arizona desert.

data.title: Nice park in the heart of the city
data.text: Take a stroll around the park, admire the rose garden, relax by the lake, catch a baseball game, visit the zoo, play golf, enroll in a wellness or fitness class... Reid park has everything!

data.title: A mult use park contains the zoo
data.text: Centrally located tucson park. Used extensively.it is in need of significant upgrades and generally maintence. Lack of money from city,etc has prevented park from growing and keeping up with other similar venues

data.title: love feeding the ducks
data.text: my family and i love to come here early and feed the ducks with out children and dogs. Its big enough so the kids tire themselves out with the ducks, playgrounds, and the running around. Yet not so huge that you feel like youre about to die from exhaustion

data.title: Great Place for Pokemon Go!
data.text: This is central Tucson's largest park. It includes many play structures, ramadas, a couple of small ponds, a small dog park, a large dog park, the Reid Park Zoo, a rose garden, an outdoor theater, a ball park, a golf course, and more. We visited the park early in the morning to search for Pokemon and captured numerous Vulpix, Ekans, Ponyta, as well as a Rapidash, a Growlithe, an Eevee, and others in about an hour. There are many trees so that you can walk from one shady spot to another without too much trouble. There are many, many poke stops throughout the park. This is a great place to bring your kids.

data.title: Enjoyable time
data.text: At our ages, my hubby & I love coming here to get away from the hustle and bustle, watch the little kids faces and just have an outstanding, relaxing time.

data.title: Grass, pond with ducks and zoo
data.text: Large park adjacent to golf course.  The zoo is good for all ages, but especially children.  The ducks at the pond are fun to watch.  Avoid this area at dusk and night, due to criminal elements.  Free parking.  Not a good place to go in the summer due to heat extremes.

data.title: Nice big park
data.text: A nice place to hang out, especially with the many events held there.  Needs more parking for events.

data.title: Nice Family Park
data.text: As city parks go, this is a good one There's a lake and a few ball fields, a zoo and a larger ball field for spring training. Plenty of grassy hills and ducks for the kids to look at. The dome for concerts is pretty small, but still have some good music from time to time.

data.title: Great place for family
data.text: They offer playgrounds, lakes with ducks etc...as well as a little train that goes around the park. The zoo is also located right there so you can make a day out of it or stop by for just a little while. keep in mind in the summer the playground equipment will burn your kids be careful!

data.title: Pleasant for groups or families
data.text: I attended a group event here. There was plenty of parking, lots of trees, playgrounds, a rose garden, a duck pond, public restrooms. The park is nicely maintained with ramadas, tables, bbq grills and room to run around and play or paths to take leisurely walks. A wedding was being held in one section of the park, and families were playing and picnicking. In the event you forgot anything, nearby was a Circle K that I ran to for ice.
